title: Spack not looking for virtual dependencies in custom repositories

labels.name: fixed-by-new-concretizer
labels.description: An issue that is resolved by the ASP-based concretizer

body:
I needed to apply a patch to libtirpc package to export `$prefix/include/tirpc` in CPATH. So, I copied it to a custom repository and edited it. Here is my `repos.yaml`
```
repos:
- /scratch/mack8/a/amaji/custom_packages
- $spack/var/spack/repos/builtin
```
Now if I do `spack spec -l libtirpc` things work fine. I can also install libtirpc.
```
$ spack spec -l libtirpc %gcc@8.3.1
Input spec
--------------------------------
libtirpc%gcc@8.3.1

Concretized
--------------------------------
==> Warning: Skipping package at /scratch/mack8/a/amaji/spack-test-20210324/framework/spack/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/libtirpc.bak. "libtirpc.bak" is not a valid Spack module name.
==> Warning: gcc@8.3.1 cannot build optimized binaries for "zen2". Using best target possible: "zen"
gxkfhga  libtirpc@1.2.6%gcc@8.3.1 arch=linux-centos8-zen
yzhsri5      ^krb5@1.18.2%gcc@8.3.1 arch=linux-centos8-zen
tprtgu6          ^bison@3.6.4%gcc@8.3.1 arch=linux-centos8-zen
ujpucgt              ^diffutils@3.7%gcc@8.3.1 arch=linux-centos8-zen
qbonzhy                  ^libiconv@1.16%gcc@8.3.1 arch=linux-centos8-zen
qceagpt              ^help2man@1.47.11%gcc@8.3.1 arch=linux-centos8-zen
6m52oox                  ^gettext@0.21%gcc@8.3.1+bzip2+curses+git~libunistring+libxml2+tar+xz arch=linux-centos8-zen
ygtt2p3                      ^bzip2@1.0.8%gcc@8.3.1+shared arch=linux-centos8-zen
6cnl654                      ^libxml2@2.9.10%gcc@8.3.1~python arch=linux-centos8-zen
m5xrq75                          ^pkgconf@1.7.3%gcc@8.3.1 arch=linux-centos8-zen
n7lawhk                          ^xz@5.2.5%gcc@8.3.1~pic arch=linux-centos8-zen
3jwt5sg                          ^zlib@1.2.11%gcc@8.3.1+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-centos8-zen
2c2b4et                      ^ncurses@6.2%gcc@8.3.1~symlinks+termlib arch=linux-centos8-zen
dcky6it                      ^tar@1.32%gcc@8.3.1 arch=linux-centos8-zen
744u27d                  ^perl@5.32.0%gcc@8.3.1+cpanm+shared+threads arch=linux-centos8-zen
gtaesiu                      ^berkeley-db@18.1.40%gcc@8.3.1 arch=linux-centos8-zen
7mja3it                      ^gdbm@1.18.1%gcc@8.3.1 arch=linux-centos8-zen
42k4c76                          ^readline@8.0%gcc@8.3.1 arch=linux-centos8-zen
bvdpqvw              ^m4@1.4.18%gcc@8.3.1+sigsegv patches=3877ab548f88597ab2327a2230ee048d2d07ace1062efe81fc92e91b7f39cd00,fc9b61654a3ba1a8d6cd78ce087e7c96366c290bc8d2c299f09828d793b853c8 arch=linux-centos8-zen
wwnsges                  ^libsigsegv@2.12%gcc@8.3.1 arch=linux-centos8-zen
ornw2fp          ^openssl@1.1.1d%gcc@8.3.1+systemcerts arch=linux-centos8-zen
```
But if I try to install `hdf` which depends on `libtirpc`:
```
$ spack spec -l hdf %gcc@8.3.1
Input spec
--------------------------------
hdf%gcc@8.3.1

Concretized
--------------------------------
==> Warning: Skipping package at /scratch/mack8/a/amaji/spack-test-20210324/framework/spack/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/libtirpc.bak. "libtirpc.bak" is not a valid Spack module name.
==> Warning: gcc@8.3.1 cannot build optimized binaries for "zen2". Using best target possible: "zen"
==> Error: Package 'libtirpc' not found.
```

Am I missing something or is Spack losing track of custom repos when installing dependencies?

Expected behavior: `hdf` package should be coming from `builtin` and `libtirpc` package should be coming from `custom_packages`.
